intro: Hieracium dolichocaulodes, commonly known as the long-stemmed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. It features hairy stems and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are alternate, rough to the touch, and often have a lobed or serrated edge.
